notesStmt.note: Thanks go to Pyndap for her patience during all the hours that I spent on this project!

projectDesc.p: This dictionary comes to you through nice people making it available for free and for good. It is part of the FreeDict project, http://www.freedict.org / http://freedict.de. This project aims to make available many translating dictionaries for free. Your contributions are welcome!

change.item: Reached 1900 entries, split examples from their translations

sense.def: the first letter (Capital A, and small letter a) of the Khasi Alphabet. It is a sign of a Vowel (Sawa-hi). Its sound is very open, more than the a of the English exclamation Ah!
indicating joy, sorrow, surprise, warning
sense.note: In English the interjections A, Ah are written with a capital letter, but it does not seem justified to follow this rule also in Khasi.
The Apostrophe (') is often used in Khasi to indicate that some letter or letters have been omitted, specially in compound words: ar'ti-ar'jat, 'tiewkulab, for arkti-arkjat, syntiew-kulab.

sense.def: imitative for the cry of the crow

entry.def: red colour used by Hindus during the Holi festival

trans.tr: as the Akjakor thristing for blood

eg.q: U khiew u la long ban pyndonkam.

trans.tr: The pot is ready for use.

eg.q: U dei u ksew.
U briew u iaid ha surok.
Kane ka waitlam; buhrieh ia ka hapoh ka soptilor jong phi.
U don hapoh sem.

sense.note: a toy that turns standing at its top and falls when powered out

sense.def: precedes the object following a transitive verb

sense.note: in example: na instead of ia?

eg.q: Ym lah ban iohi ei ei ia ka ïing jong u nongrep.

trans.tr: Nothing could be seen of the farmer's cottage.

eg.q: Ha tdong u khiew um ka lah ban iohi ia ka um khyndiat.
Ki la mareh stet katba lah.

trans.tr: They ran as fast as they could.

eg.q: Nga leit sha i papa.
U bnai bad ki khlur kin wan ha ka jaka jong nga.
Ka ktien jong u ka jam kat u pyrthat.

trans.tr: His voice is as loud as thunder.

eg.q: U don ei ei ban leh.

trans.tr: He has got something to do.

eg.q: Ri bha ia la ka burom!
Sngewbha ap khyndiat!
U kdew ia ka masi sawbthuh ka baitynnad.

trans.tr: He points at a nice brown cow.

eg.q: Phah ia kine ki kot kloi katba lah.

trans.tr: Send these books as soon as possible.

eg.q: La lah buh ia ki nongap ha ka khyrdop.

trans.tr: The guards could have been stationed at the gate.

sense.def: denotes infinitive of the following verb

eg.q: U nang ban thoh.
Kane ka kotsada ka lieh kum ka dud.

sense.def: older brother

eg.q: Ki masi i bah ki ieng hangtai.

sense.def: person

eg.q: Ka kot i mei hangtai.

sense.def: younger brother

eg.q: Ale hangne!
Khie sha la ka jaka.

sense.def: denotes possession

eg.q: la ka kti

sense.def: denotes dimension of measures

eg.q: 20 la 14 miter

sense.def: denotes past tense of the following verb

eg.q: la iap

sense.def: denotes passive voice of following verb

eg.q: La shna ia ka kotsada na ja jainjot.
shilynning ki siej
U skain u dem ha ka dud.
U syiem shisien u la donkam shakri uba u lah ban shaniah.
Ka simad ka don ha ka rok.

sense.def: put after a number to indicate countability

eg.q: Ngi don saw ngut ki nonghikai.
Ki ong ba kin wan hapdeng shisngi ne arsngi, hynrei kim poi haduh mynta.
Ka jyrngam kum u phlang.
Kumno phi long?
Ai doh!
Ngan leit noh sha kiwei pat ki ri.
Bet ia u symbai ha lyngkha!
U kren ha ka jingïalang ki khynnah skul.

trans.tr: He speaks at the students' conference.

eg.q: Don saw aiom shisnem.

trans.tr: There are four seasons in a year.

sense.def: in the sense of over as in "time is up"

eg.q: Ka por ka la biang.
U da tlot eh.
Phi la don katno ha kane ka school?

trans.tr: How long have you been in this school?

eg.q: Ka skul ka la wai.
U bor bad u Shap ki ialong shilok.
Leh kumba nga leh!

sense.def: in numbers: denotes a decimal position of 10

eg.q: shiphew

sense.def: filling word used in connection with future tense

eg.q: Ngin sa suk.
Wat bitar ia u.

sense.def: denotes present continuous tense of following verb

eg.q: dang leit

sense.def: denotes perfect tense of the following verb

eg.q: ba la leit

sense.def: makes an adjective out of the following verb

eg.q: baleit
Ap ynda nga wan!

sense.def: denotes superlative of following verb

eg.q: Ki la hikai ia u ban kren hok.

trans.tr: They have taught him to speak the truth.

eg.q: U la iap ha ka pop.
La shah ia ki Phareng ban leit noh khlem jingma ei ei.

trans.tr: The Europeans (foreigners?) were allowed to go away without any harm.

eg.q: da ka jingiarap jong u
Nga tip ba u blei u ieit ia ngi.

trans.tr: I know that god loves us.

eg.q: Ka sngi ka nangshit.
Ngi la iamih tang shu rang u slap.
Eiba ong ia phi ba i kpa jong u i pang?
La map ia ki pop jong phi.
U la ioh ban pam shibun ka snepdieng.

sense.def: undressing oneself

eg.q: U la law noh bak ia ka shakuriaw na ka masi.

trans.tr: He took off the bell from the cow.

eg.q: La u duk hynrei u suk bad u sngewhun ia la ka nusip.
Phim lah ban shakri ia u blei bad ia ka spah.

trans.tr: You cannot serve god and riches.

sense.def: denotes the number one of the following substantive

eg.q: Ngi ap haduh ba un da wan.
U nongthawkhiew u phai ïa ka shaka da la ka kjat.

trans.tr: The potter spins the wheel with his foot.

eg.q: U kwah ban siew noh ia ka ram.
Ki don kyrhai ka bam ka dih.

trans.tr: They have plenty to eat and drink.

eg.q: Ka jingtrei ka wallam jingsngewbha.
Ka jingshai bad jingshit ki la wan na ka sngi.
Ka thang ia ka sharak.
Ia ka America la shem da u Kolombos.
U ksew u mareh nadien jong u bad u la lap ia u.
Peit shane!
U theid ia ka jingkhang.
Rah ki kti!
Ka lyer ka sdang ban beh.
Nga tong um na ka pung.

trans.tr: I draw water from the well.

eg.q: La ngat ia ka sati ha u shang.

trans.tr: The ring has been caught up in the basket.

eg.q: Ka lymbit ka i kum ka sim haba ka her.

trans.tr: The bat looks like a bird when it flies.

eg.q: U sing u la bam shibun ki mrad khlaw.

trans.tr: The lion has devoured many wild animals.

eg.q: U bsein u puh ia u syiar.
U slap u hap.
U shylluid syntiew u la phuh.
Ang shyntur!
La thoh ia ka kyrteng jong phi ha kitab ka jingim.

trans.tr: Your name is written in the book of life.

eg.q: Ngan ialam ia phi bad nga.

trans.tr: I will take you with me.

eg.q: Haba ki maw ki hap shapoh, ka um la sdang ban kiew ha u khiew um.
U ngap u kynup.

sense.note: lay in the sense of "lay eggs"

eg.q: La kha ia u Sayed ha Delhi ha ka 17th October 1817.

trans.tr: Sayed was born at Delhi on the 17th October 1817.

eg.q: U runsied nalor kynroh.
Ka dngiem ka kiew shalor u dieng.

sense.def: pointer of a clock
100 paise = 1 rupee

eg.q: Ngi la pyrkhat ia ka la slem jlang.

trans.tr: We had pondered over it for a long time.

eg.q: Iapli ia kane ka lut!
U khynnah u dang ap ia ki masi.

trans.tr: The boy is looking after the cattle.

eg.q: Shong khop!
leit noh
ot noh
U la bat la ka juban.
Ki khun ki dei ban kohnguh bad burom ia la ki kmie ki kpa.

trans.tr: Children should obey and respect their parents.

sense.def: city 60 km south of Shillong
grammatical particle to express negative past tense

eg.q: Em, um shym wan hangne.

trans.tr: No, he did not come here.

eg.q: Uno u khun jong phi?

sense.def: city 40 km east of Shillong, capital of Jaintia hills

eg.q: U trei smat.
U kulai u don u tdong shniuh uba jrong.

trans.tr: The horse has a long hairy tail.

eg.q: Ka jubab jong phi ka dei.
Ka jingkhein jong u ka bakla.
Ka jingpang ka la nang duna.
Kane ka jingkhein ka lait.
Ngan iarap ia phi ban lait.

trans.tr: I will help you to get away.

sense.def: from "briew shlur"

eg.q: Kato ka sopti poh ka kylluid eh ia phi.

trans.tr: This shirt is too loose for you.

sense.note: Used in the absence of any article or if the article cannot be repeated, as in "un ym = he will not".

eg.q: Em, ym don eiei.
Balei phi bam ia ki sohpieng im?
Ka baiwai ka rem ha kane ka jaka.

trans.tr: The rent is high in this locality.

eg.q: Suki ban kular hynrei kloi ban pyndep.

trans.tr: Be slow to promise but quick to perform.

eg.q: Nga la pynioh jingtrei ia phi bad u nongrep.

trans.tr: I have got you a job with the farmer.

eg.q: Khyndiat mail na Amsterdam la don kawei ka shnong ka barit ba la khot Saardam.

trans.tr: Some miles from Amsterdam a small village called Saardam is located.

eg.q: U sah sa ka kor thew jingthew.
Phin sa lieh kat ka ior.

trans.tr: You will be white as snow.

eg.q: Ka kham bha ia u ban leit noh.

trans.tr: It is better for him to go away.

eg.q: Nga la kham shait.
Ngam da long eh uba sian.
Phim lah ban leh ei ei khlem ma nga, kumta phim dei ban sarong.
Wat wan hangne!
Une u lain um beit.
Ngan sa long basngewsih haba phim don shuh.

trans.tr: I'll be sad when you are no more.

eg.q: Ka kam kam long ka basngewbha satia.
shaniah ha ki ksangkti jong u
Wat bishni ia kiwei pat.
La pynbor ia nga ban kren iada lade.

trans.tr: I am compelled to speak in my defence.

eg.q: Ym don uba lah ban shakri ar kynrad.

trans.tr: No man can serve two masters.

eg.q: Ia ngin ialehkai!
Iehnoh ia u marwei!
Sngewbha ñiew kine ki kam kum kiba kyrkieh eh.

trans.tr: Please treat these matters as urgent.

eg.q: Ngeit ha u Trai.
Kan kan iadei ia ka jingthmu jongngi.
Ka kam ka don ka jingthmu hadien jong ka.

trans.tr: Work has a motive behind it.

eg.q: Ngam don tyngka ha lade.

trans.tr: I have no money with me.

eg.q: Um hiar na u kulai.

trans.tr: He got down from the horse.

eg.q: Um shym ialeh tyngeh?

trans.tr: Did he not try his utmost?

eg.q: Kam shym jot shuh.

trans.tr: It was no longer in ruins.

eg.q: Ym don um ha ka klat.

trans.tr: There is no water in the glass.

eg.q: Ngam lah ban sngewnguh ia phi katba dei.
U kren jam than.
Ieng skhem na ka bynta ka hok.
Ka hok ka long ka buit babha tam.
Man ka por kren ia ka bashisha.
U nonghikai yn pynshitom ne un beh ia phi.

trans.tr: The teacher will punish or expel you.

eg.q: Bat skhem ia ka tduh une u pita.
U riewalhia niar eh ba u long u briew u basuk.
Phi la ju poi Sohra?
Phin leit la shisngi?

trans.tr: Will you go day after tomorrow?

eg.q: Ngan leit Sohra lada kam slap jur.
Lano un poi?
Lada phim minot, phin ym lah ha ka eksamin.
Ngi pynpait ia ka khyndew da ka dieng moi.
U long u bakhlain kat u ramhah.
La leh ia kane ka kam khamtam eh ha ka jaka ba la khot Aligarh.

trans.tr: The work was chiefly done in the place called Aligarh.

eg.q: Ka klas VI ka jop ia ka jingiakhun.
Ka la ju phah ia u ba un spel biang ia ki lynnong mynmiet.

trans.tr: She used to make him repeat the lessons at night.

eg.q: U la pynleit lut la ka por balait sha kane ka kam.

trans.tr: He gave all his spare time to this work.

eg.q: U la lum lang katto katne ki riewdonburom.
U la pynlut shibun ka por bad la ka kmie.

trans.tr: He spent much time with his mother.

eg.q: Mynno phi wan na Calcutta?
Ka rel ka khreh ban mih; u nongap u la put ia ka jingput.
Ka tngab kam lah ban kot ia ka um.
La tei ïa kane ka kynroh da u mawit bad ka sorki.

trans.tr: This wall is built with brick and mortar.

eg.q: U jen u la tar ia la ka sopti poh.
Nga khrai diengiap.
I kpa i khet dieng.
U pynsyrwa ia la ka por.
shi rynjup ki shabi
shiphong ki sopti
shikyntien ka ja
shisbuk ka mar
Ngi lah ban leh la ki kam ki duk da ka jingdonakor bad jingryntih.

trans.tr: We may be able to perform our duties with decency and order.

eg.q: U don ka bor ban tohkit ia kano kano ka kam na ki liang baroh.

trans.tr: He could examine any question from all sides.

eg.q: Phi nang ban tem bela?

trans.tr: Do you know how to play violin?

sense.def: n + ym after a negative article (that always ends in -n)

eg.q: Kin nym lah ban pyndep ia ka khala khala.

trans.tr: They could not finish it soon.

eg.q: Ki khynnah ki dang ia kawang maw ia ki jakoid.
Ki dang theh ia ka um ha u khiew.
Hamar ba ngi dang iakren lwet...
Ngan wan lang bad phi?
Haba nga die ia u san tynka nga shu ai baitrai ia phi.

trans.tr: When I sell it for five rupees, I am practically giving it to you at cost price.

eg.q: Ki rijied jong ka iingshetja jong ngi ki lyngkot than.
La thaw ia u narwoh na ka rnong.
Eiba wah ia ka map ha kynroh?
Nga donkam shiphew ngut ki misteri maw.
Sngewbha ai ia nga shinat ka kait!

trans.tr: Please give me a bundle of plantains!

eg.q: Bun than ki nonghset ki pynsniew ia ka syrwa.

trans.tr: Too many cooks spoil the broth.

sense.def: 1 quintal = 100 kg

eg.q: Wat ju dih kiad!
Ngam bang ia kane ka jyntah.
Ki masi ki lur ia ka lyngkha.
U smai da ka kyrteng U Blei ban um lamler.
U la ioh jinghikai ka bapaka.
Nga la ioh pangbniat.
Kim nang Hindi ruh.
U bnai um don jingshai na lade hi.

trans.tr: The moon doesn't have light of its own.

eg.q: Ha bakut un phoida lada u iathuh hok.

trans.tr: In the end he will gain if he tells the truth.

eg.q: Ki wan hangne shisien ne arsien katba nga kynmaw.

trans.tr: They come here once or twice as far as i remember.

eg.q: Kim nud ban mih shabar ki sheptieng bsien.

trans.tr: They are not anxious to go out for fear of snakes.

eg.q: Haduh katno phin sah hangne?
Ngi kyrpad ia phi ba phin ianoh sha ka jingkynshew.

trans.tr: We request you to contribute to the fund.

eg.q: Nga khriat.
Ka dohnud u Lar ka long kaba eh kum u maw.
Kato ka lyntang ka jlih kum ka iit.
Ngam shlur kat ma u.

trans.tr: I am not as brave as he.

eg.q: Ka ri jong ngi ka khmih lynti manla u briew ban leh la ka kamram.

trans.tr: Our country expects every man to do his duty.

eg.q: I jem mom-mom kum ka makhon.

trans.tr: It is very soft like butter.

eg.q: Wat bam than eh bad bam ia ka jingbam ka baiadei.
Ka jingshad sawdong jong ka pyrthei man ka sngi ka pyllong ia ka sngi bad miet.

trans.tr: The daily motion of the earth causes day and night.

eg.q: Ka pyrthei ka tawiar sawdong ia ka sngi.
Ka sla jong ka pyrthei ka kynthup ia ka khyndew bad ka um.

trans.tr: The surface of the earth consists of land and water.

eg.q: U jumai u pynkyllon ia ka nongbah baroh khoit.

trans.tr: The earthquake shakes down the whole town.

eg.q: Ka pyrem jong ka jingim ka long ka jinglong samla.

trans.tr: The spring of life is youth.

eg.q: Shano phin leit ha kane ka shuti lyiur?
Ka khriat shibun hangne myntlang.
Phi tip ia ka jingjngai jong ka pyrthei na ka sngi?
U mih skul mynba u dang khadhynniew snem ka rta.

trans.tr: He left school at the age of seventeen.

eg.q: Don bun ki sabut ba ka pyrthei kam long ka bamadan.
Nga ioh sakhlieh, kumta ngan shong noh ha iing.

trans.tr: I have a cold, so I will stay indoors.

eg.q: Ki sla ki tlor noh ha ka por synrai.
Ngam don ksiar lane rupa.

trans.tr: I have neither gold nor silver.

eg.q: Ai um ia u shisyndon lym kumta un iap!

trans.tr: Give him water at once, otherwise he will die!

eg.q: Iathuh ia nga la phin leit ne em!
La nga mai ia u, hynrei um sngap satia.
U bakhlain, pynban um treh ban trei minot.

trans.tr: He is strong, still he refuses to work hard.

eg.q: U rynsied kham jrong ban ia nga.
Ngam lah ban wan namar ba nga ioh biongkhlieh naduh hynne ka miet.
Pynmih ia kine ki tyngka sawphew sha ki peisa.
U slap u rang.
Riam shuwa ba phin mih na ka kamra.

trans.tr: Dress yourself before you leave the room.

eg.q: Ym treh?
U khynnah u kyllut ne um nangkren.

trans.tr: The child is either deaf or dumb.

eg.q: Ka pum pum bad ki jakhlia jakhlaid kin khuid lut.
Ki sim kin sangeh ka rwai ka siaw.
La pynbor ia u ban leh ia kane pyrshah ia ka mon jong u.

trans.tr: He was compelled to do this against his wish.

eg.q: ka ain ka ri

trans.tr: in the midst of the forest

form.orth: hapoh kitei kiei kiei ba la ong haneng

eg.q: Nga shongthait hapoh ka jingkah syrngiew u dieng.
U long uwei napdeng ki babun, kumta phim dei ban sngewrem ia kata.
Un wan hapdeng ar ne lai baje noh-phai-sngi.
Ngam lah ban leh ia kata namar ka long sha lyndet ka bor jong nga.
U leh ia kane pyrshah ia ka mon jong nga.
U la khie joit na bathiah.
La lah pynmlien ia nga naduh dang-khynnah.

trans.tr: I could be taught good habits since childhood.

sense.def: rice plants

eg.q: Ha ka por aiu ki bet kba?
U nongot nangta u wan bad la ka rashi bad u ot noh ia ki jingthung.
Te ki briew ki dung ia u kba bad ki sa peh ia ki symboh.
Te ki briew ki dung ia u kba bad ki sa peh ia ki symboh.
Ki Khasi ki bam da u khaw.
Ki nongrep ki ot ia u kba da ka rashi haba u la ih.
Phi iohi ia ki speh ki bajyrngam?
Te ka la pyrshang ban pynkylla khongpong ia u khiew um khnang ba ka um ka lah ban mih shabar.

sense.def: hole in iris of the eye

eg.q: Ia ki jainjot linen la buh ha kawei ka kynton.

trans.tr: The linen rags are put in one heap.

eg.q: La jied is u Suba ban pynmareh thong.

trans.tr: Suba is chosen to start the race.

eg.q: La jied ia u Suba ban pynmareh thong.

trans.tr: Suba is chosen to start the race.

eg.q: Ia ka Sita la kyrsiew na ki jingphohsniew lyngngai.

trans.tr: Sita was waken from her pleasant dreams.

eg.q: La ai ruh ha u ia kiwei pat ki burom.

trans.tr: Other honours were also bestowed upon him.

eg.q: La pynkyndit kynsan kynsan ia u nongkhaii.

trans.tr: The merchant was taken by surprise.

eg.q: Hangta la pdiang sngewbha ia u Ram da u para jong u Bharat.
La pynshitom jur ia u khynnah da ki nonghikai namar ka kingpep skul tuh.
La ai penshon ia u bad ia u khun jong u da ka sorkar.
Ki la lah sngewthuh bha ia ka kam.

trans.tr: They could understand the matter fully well.

eg.q: La lah rai ia ka mukotduma la slem jlang.

trans.tr: The case had been decided long ago.

eg.q: U la phla ia kaba u la leh.

trans.tr: He confessed what he had done.

eg.q: Ki la lah shimti ia kane ka kam mynnymwei.

trans.tr: They could have taken up this matter last year.

eg.q: La lah pynmane ia ki la slem bah.

trans.tr: They cold have been subdued since a long time.

eg.q: Ki la lah iohi ia la ka jingbakla bad ki la kylla jingmut.

trans.tr: They could have seen their mistake and have changed their mind.

eg.q: La pynkmen ia ka dohnud jong ki.
Ka lah pynmlien ia nga naduh dang-khynnah.

trans.tr: She could practice me since childhood.

eg.q: La pynim ia u bad ka iing jong u.

trans.tr: Life was given to him and his house.

eg.q: Nga leit shim dur.

trans.tr: I go and fetch photos (from the development studio).

eg.q: U la ong kumne harum: ...
Ia ngin ialeit sha khlaw bad ngin iathoh dieng katto-katne.

trans.tr: Let's go to the jungle and cut some wood.

eg.q: U lok jong u la thiah kram ha khyndew bad um khih um ksaid.

trans.tr: His friend fell down to the ground and lay quite still.

eg.q: U lok jong u la thiah kram ha khyndew bad um khih um ksaid.

trans.tr: His friend fell down to the ground and lay quite still.

eg.q: Manla ka masi ka don ka shakuriaw ha ka ryndang jong ka.

trans.tr: Every cow has a bell round her neck.

eg.q: U nongthawkhiew u shong ha khmat ka shaka jong u.
U nongthawkhiew u pynwandur ïa u khiew.
Ka jingsarong ka leit ha shuwa ka jingjot.
Burom ia ki bahalor jong phi!
Khlem u lok ka pyrthei ka long tang ka ri khlaw.

trans.tr: Without a friend the world is but a wilderness.

eg.q: U Uberto u la kren ha la u lok samla.
Ka jingjaipdeh ka long ka kmie jong ka jingkyrduh.

trans.tr: Sloth is the mother of poverty.
